channel.title: Updates: Long COVID Questionnaire Responses [Records Request]
channel.description: Updates on the Data Liberation Project's Long COVID Questionnaire Responses request

item.title: Appeal Filed
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On November 13, 2023, we submitted an appeal üìÑ to HHS regarding this case. The appeal has been assigned tracking number 2024-00037-A-PHS.

item.title: Request Denied
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On September 8, 2023, the NIH emailed a letter denying access to the requested records üìÑ, ‚Äúpursuant to Exemptions 3 and 6 of the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. ¬ß 552(b)(3) and (b)(6) and sections 5.65 and 5.67 of the HHS FOIA Regulations, 45 C.F.R. Part 5.‚Äù The Exemption 3 argument cites ‚Äú42 USC 241(f), which exempts certain biomedical information from disclosure if it is ‚Äòabout an individual and that is gathered or used during the course of biomedical research if, (A) an individual is identified; or (B) there is at least a very small risk, as determined by current scientific practices or statistical methods, that some combination of the information, the request, and other available data sources could be used to deduce the identity of an individual.‚Äô‚Äú The NIH did not indicate which aspects of the records would pose this risk, or how. Regarding our request for documentation, the NIH pointed to a data dictionary available online.

item.title: Request Acknowledged, Fee Waiver Not Yet Determined
item.author: The Data Liberation Project
item.description: On December 1, 2022, NHLBI emailed a letter üìÑ acknowledging our request and noting, “Because we are uncertain that any applicable fees will exceed our minimum charge ($25.00), we are not addressing your request for a fee waiver at this time.”
